name: People Problem "Maximum Perversion" 7" (Coffin Cut #11)
description: Western Australian band. People Problem "Maximum Perversion" 7" (Coffin Cut #11). 150 copies all on green vinyl. Someone told me this sounds like "the energy of a young Hellmen mixed with the speed and obnoxiousness of Heist." Pretty spot on, eh? Price represents costs of pressing a small number of records and shipping them halfway across the planet. Music is a discretionary purchase. People Problem "Maximum Perversion" Coffin Cut Records #11 (7") by Coffin Cut Records

name: Rupture "Corrupture" LP + flexi (limited version)
description: Perth 101. Green-grey vinyl with white flexi. Limited version. Gatefold cover hence postage cost.

name: Frozen Ocean 7" (Coffin Cut Records #7)
description: Frantic and ramshackle two piece Western Australian backyard punk. Descendents of that early 90s Perth scene - Benji, Baked, Chapter Music, and especially O - and proof that "regional sounds" still exist. Drum Music said: "Screeching feedback welcomes their vinyl debut and when twangy guitar, muffled vocals and thrashing drums combine to make a wall of noise, it's clear that Frozen Ocean's gritty no-frills punk is bets delivered through a format just as raw." 300 copies on multi coloured vinyl. Each record is a different colour; if you order more than one, I'll send each copy on a different base colour (i.e. one red with black streaks, one yellow with green streaks). They range from quite solid primary colours to very wild looking "oystered" white, peacock feather green... Review from YellowGreenRed: "Frozen Ocean seems like a name fit for a bearded metal-core outfit, not whatever this demented band is. All the better to surprise me, then, as First Fucking Vynil (their spelling, not mine) is about as raw and psychotic as hardcore-punk can get. I’m reminded of some sort of unholy mix of White Load and Exit Hippies, but with a slight touch of the blues… and maybe a little black metal? It sounds like a complete mess, and it certainly is, but Frozen Ocean are downright captivating in the way that they make rock music sound like the worst crime a person can commit. I am imagining a world where fans of Meatshits and Rupture (musically, not lyrically) can join up with beer-drinking Homostupids fans and abuse metal riffs together. And I’m pretty sure Frozen Ocean are a two-piece! Clearly, wonders never cease with these wackos." Frozen Ocean, Coffin Cut Records #7 (7") by Coffin Cut Records

name: Deathcage / Unknown to God 12" + 7" die hard grey vinyl version (Coffin Cut #9)
description: Deathcage/Unknown to God split 12". This is the die hard grey vinyl 12" plus grey vinyl 7", in a gatefold jacket. The 7" contains a Discharge cover from each band and is limited to 100 copies. This will not be repressed. Sydney hardcore punk. Unquestionable heritage. Deathcage, former members of Redstain, Smash n Grab, Ether Rag, Murder Disco X and Headless Horsemen. Unknown to God, former members of Omnicide, Subversion, Noisam, Beastianity, Twin City Faction and Frank Rizzo. Live, they give the violent, conversionist performances these end times deserve: both bands bleed for the cause (as may you), and are heavily influenced by the Japanese masters of these dark arts - Deathside, Crow, Crude, Bastard, and Zouo (as you should also be). There are also embroidered Deathcage patches for some of these copies. Use the drop down feature to select this. Once the patches have run out, you will only be able to order the 12" plus 7" without a patch. Unknown to God "Never Again" (Discharge cover) from the split 7" with Deathcage by Coffin Cut Records Deathcage "Why?" (Discharge cover) from the split 7" with Unknown to God by Coffin Cut Records DOMESTIC POSTAGE NOTE: this weighs over 500 grams (it's a 12" in a gatefold jacket with a 7") and costs 13 dollars to post in Australia. If you want to order ANYTHING else, I will post it all in a satchel and you will pay no more postage. Once you have ordered this item please email me at coffincutrecords@gmail.com and let me know what else you'd like to add to the order. I will then send you an invoice for the additional items. INTERNATIONAL POSTAGE NOTE: Apologies for the cost of international mail order. It's very expensive to send parcels from Australia to anywhere else in the world. Your charges represent the actual cost of postage only and do not include paypal fees or mailers.

name: Chickenshit "Death in Battle" 7" white vinyl (Coffin Cut #1)
description: Chickenshit "Death in Battle". Remastered studio and live recordings from the mid-1990s. Chickenshit started in the early 1990s in Perth, playing fast and distorted, Japanese style hardcore (Chicken Bowels, Gil, Bastard etc). The band had a number of releases on Japanese labels (MCR, HG Fact), and played, drunk and fought at gigs with Rupture, Nailed Down, Runt and other Perth heavyweights of the era. Side A is remastered studio recordings. Side B is live at the Castle 1995, from the infamous Rupture "hole in the ceiling" show. Side B was originally released on Pagan Waste Tapes as a cassette. White vinyl limited to 250 and only available from here. No trades or wholesale on white vinyl. Chickenshit "Death in Battle" Coffin Cut Records #1 (7") by Coffin Cut Records

name: Chickenshit "Death in Battle" 7" red vinyl (Coffin Cut #1)

The band had a number of releases on Japanese labels (MCR, HG Fact), and played, drunk and fought at gigs with Rupture, Nailed Down, Runt and other Perth heavyweights of the era. Side A is remastered studio recordings. Side B is live at the Castle 1995, from the infamous Rupture "hole in the ceiling" show. Side B was originally released on Pagan Waste Tapes as a cassette. Red vinyl limited to 250 and available for trade and wholesale. Minimum of 5 copies for wholesale rates, discounts for 10 plus copies. No consignment. Chickenshit "Death in Battle" Coffin Cut Records #1 (7") by Coffin Cut Records

name: Negative Reinforcement s/t 7" (Coffin Cut Records #5)
description:
Raw metallic hardcore punk from Perth, Western Australia. Dark and hateful, this 7” combines the grunt of Think I Care, the spastic pace of Lack Of Interest and the dissonance of Rorschach and Die Kreuzen. Pulverising and vicious, the familiar slam of USHC collides with the viscera of cult metal. Ugly music for ugly minds from the diseased island. Mixed by Will Killingsworth (Hoax, Salvation, Mind Eraser).

300 copies, black vinyl only. 

Postage is $1.80 in Australia - the actual postage charge. Will be posted the next day.

name: Extreme Noise Terror "Tear it Down" 7" (1986 recordings)
description:
Remastered, unrealease recordings from way back when. 

"These tracks were recorded at same studio as Earslaughter in Dec '86. The first 2 songs(Side-A) have never been heard by ANYONE since and were never played live or released in anyway. This was our first ever recording with Mick Harris on drums but all the other members are the very original ENT line up. Unfortunately the lyrics for these songs are long forgotten only the song titles remain. The second track "What a State" is the first time ENT used the blast beat"
 
A-1. TEAR IT DOWN 
A-2. WHAT A STATE 
B-1. FALSE PROPHET
 
Recording member (Dec/1986): 

DEAN JONES : VOCALS 
PHIL VANE : VOCALS 
MICH HARRIS : DRUMS 
PETE HURLEY : GUITAR 
JERRY CLAY : BASS

description: Issue 12 of Perth's Jerk Store Fanzine. 52 pages, professionally printed. There's also the usual avalanche of unsubstantiated rumour, wild conjecture and pointless drivel, topped off by something like eighty-five record, tape, 'zine and book reviews."

name: Lewis Dimmick "This Music" book
description:
The first book I've stocked: Lewis Dimmick's "This Music" published by Wardance Records.

Not a historical account but a personal one: a collection of reflections and memories on growing up in New York on a diet of metal and punk, and playing and hanging out at CBGB's in the mid to late 80s.

name: My Rifle 7"
description: My Rifle 7" on clear vinyl. Upfront, introspective NY HC, featuring members of Our Gang, Upfront, and Life's Blood. This is one of the best NY eps I have heard in a long time. Highly recommended. Clear vinyl. MY RIFLE- "By The Grave Of God" by Wardance Records

name: Caged Animal 7"
description:
Caged Animal 7", described almost everywhere as "ignorant hardcore" - not ignorant in a Lockin' Out streetwear party bro way, but in a thick-necked barbaric, Negative Approach x Madball + metallic hardcore way. 

Cover photo by Martin Sorrondeguy, intro by Antwon and Crazy Lactose Dan (aka DJ Eons One) from Spazz. 

The label says:

Okay, the debut seven-track(+) CAGED ANIMAL EP is out and packed to the gills with knuckle-dragging, no nonsense, ignorant, moshable HC from this new-ish Bay Area band. There's not one ounce of originality in these grooves, if that's what you're looking for, but if it ain't broke, don't try to fix it, right. 330 copies, total press, with 110 copies on green wax, and 220 on black. Members of a lot of bands, including OVENS, SOPORS, and HUNTING PARTY, for those keeping score. Here's a tune, if you are curious...

name: Noothgrush / Suppression 5" (limited version with puzzle or regular version)
description:
Split 5" from these veterans, the limited version comes with a puzzle of the cover art, and a hand numbered insert. The regular version, without.

The Sleeping Shaman says:

With the multitude of labels and bands sprouting up around the world, it’s easy to forget that slow was once very uncool. In the Nineties as in the Eighties, fast was the done thing in the underground as in the mainstream. There were no labels dedicated to the release and distribution of slow music (apart from Germany’s Hellhound records…), and so it was that many pivotal figures of the heavy music that we love so much today found temporary housing with punk/grind labels. Vitus were signed to SST (although Ginn never really signed any band that stuck to conventions or formula), and Burning Witch’s first 12” was put out by powerviolence supremos Slap-A-Ham. What may initially seem as an odd pairing in actual fact made a lot of sense where the misanthropy and politics were involved. After all, ultra-fast or ultra-slow, the music was made by disenfranchised individuals on the fringes of society and scene, steadfastly doing whatever the fuck they pleased in the face of indifference and ridicule. And so, Corrupted released a slew of splits with grind bands (my first exposure to the likes of Cripple Bastards!) and Eyehategod shared wax with Anal Cunt (OK, perhaps a slightly more obvious pairing!).
 
Therefore, this 5” comes as a welcome throwback to the days when fast and slow spat in the face of society together – in fact, when I first mentioned this release to Lee Shaman for inclusion on this site, he expressed surprise that Suppression were still about!  As it turns out, they still are (as a duo?), but this split was originally meant to have been released in 1998, and the material dates from around that time. Noothgrush have recently reformed and are playing sporadic dates on both sides of the Atlantic, and the Fuck Yoga /Southern Lord reissues have done much to jog our collective memories into remembering  just how good they were. I’m of the opinion that bone-headed negativity will only get you so far, and Noothgrush’s keen social conscience always rendered them a cut above, and the savage two minutes of “Flee From Hunger And Disease” re-affirm their unmatched power, in lyrics as with the riffs. A brooding lament on mankind’s tendency to violent Xenophobia, I wish I could declare this a dated relic, but sadly the theme is all too relevant, if anything more pertinent in an age where ultra-Conservatism is gaining momentum and threatening  immigrant populations as a solution to economic woes. Musically, the song is vintage Noothgrush, starting out with a mid-paced riff that sounds like a slowed-down form of the hardcore that influenced them, before taking the pace down again to the tortured and unrelenting plod of DOOM METAL.
 
Suppression manage to fit two songs into just over a minute (!) the first being a skree of noise reminiscent of Masonna at his most unlistenable (and brilliant), before launching into a mere 40 seconds of furious grind that is a beautiful chaos of drums, chainsaw guitars and massive rolling basslines. Unpleasant listening of the best kind. Methinks I shall have to get me the Suppression discography CD that Blow The Reactors (the other label involved in this split) has in stock; I was only aware of this band through their having done a split with sludge titans Grief (there’s that fast/slow juxtaposition again!), so this is a welcome introduction. There’s not really much else to say about this release! If you’re reading this, you probably know the score, it’s Noothgrush and is therefore an essential purchase, the artwork , presentation (if you’re into such nonsense you can get an edition that comes with a nifty puzzle) and music are all absolutely perfect and guaranteed to stick in your brain longer than most punk/sludge being churned out of late. Top marks all round.

name: Negative Reinforcement "Dog" 12" (Coffin Cut #6)
description:
Negative Reinforcement "Dog" 12". Coffin Cut's 6th release. One sided 12", 300 copies only.

6 songs, themed around the cycles of mental illness. The black dog chases its tail. Bleak, savage hardcore punk from the edge of Australia.

Recorded by Adam Findlay. Mastered by Jack Control (World Burns to Death) at Enormous Door. Mixed by Brad Boatright (From Ashes Rise) at Audiosiege. Backing vocals by Brad Boatright. All art and layout by Brvce (copsmakegoodtargets.blogspot.com.au).

International wholesale and trades available directly from Coffin Cut (minimum 5 copies). All domestic wholesale directly from the band.

Review from YellowGreenRed:

Dog begins with a sociopathic spoken-word piece, the sort of thing Condominium and Cult Ritual loved bothering generic hardcore kids with, and it fits this one-sided 12″ nicely – Negative Reinforcement are pure hardcore and partially nuts. It blasts right into a gnarly grind part, broken down with back-up death vocals, eventually transitioning into a heavy Mind Eraser mosh riff. What’s not to like? Negative Reinforcement is a pretty generic name, but they manage to make hardcore truly sound bleak and destructive through these seven tracks. I never quite know where they’re gonna take me, like if they’re gonna try to whip up a Die Kreuzen-ish storm, mosh like they’re Darkside NYC or dirge through the dirt like Cult Ritual used to. Real good stuff, to the point where I wish the b-side had something my stylus could stick to. From the loss of close family members through murder to the disappointment of receiving socks instead of toys for Christmas, Negative Reinforcement speak to all levels of frustrated rage.

<iframe width="100%" height="166" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="http://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Ftracks%2F57855244&show_artwork=true"></iframe>

name: Error s/t cassette (hardshell snapcase edition or regular edition)
description: These copies are the last of the hardshell snapcase edition: a repurposed thick plastic case with handmade inserts. The regular edition is the third photo.

name: Altercado Espiritual 7"
description: Terminal Escape have this to say: From the same crew of fukks responsible for the brilliant MUERTE A LA MUERTE demo comes ALTERCADO ESPIRITUAL. Blatant Boston '83 aping forced through a decades old Spanish punk meatgrinder. Irreverent vocals (shit, irreverent everything) and buzzsaw guitars cranking out riffs like there was no tomorrow. Six songs in six minutes - I don't know man, if you like hardcore then you like this. The label states: Debut 7" by THE ONLY HARDCORE BAND IN VALENCIA. For fans of early Boston and NY, hi-tops and creepy crawls, construction gloves and pile-ons, with a decidedly street-scum and mentally ill bent. War games in an age of quarrel. Limited to 200. Elephant cover edition.

name: Krimtank / Five Finger Discount 7" (with patch)
description:
Krimtank play fast and raw traditional Swedish hardcore; buzzsaw guitars, urgent shouted vocals, all sounding like it could fall apart at any moment. Five Finger Discount play straight up rnr. These copies come with a screenprinted Krimtank patch.

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/BGT2544HPiM?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Desolation 7"
description:
Blasting metallic hardcore fusing the melodic influence of Japanese "Burning spirits" hardcore with straight forward attack of US thrash and the dark tone of European Crust. DESOLATION went on Hiatus shortly after their Self-tilted prank Debut LP of 2005, but return with a new vocalist and three new tracks. Fusing influences of the members previous and current bands-BORN/DEAD, ABRUPT, STRUNG UP, SCURVY DOGS with a marked inspiration from Japanese Hardcore with relentless upbeat energy and searing leads , these are the fastest DESOLATION tracks yet, but still retain the complex song writing and bleak feel of their previous releases. Cover Features new artwork by Japanese Artist SUGI.

Splatter vinyl.

name: Urban Waste s/t 12"
description:
A re-issue of the sole EP by one of the most sought after and enigmatic bands from the earliest days of New York hardcore. Despite the obscurity of the original release, Urban Waste was made famous through their signature style of blown-out, over the top hardcore punk replete with trademark menacing buzzsaw guitars and piercing vocals. Comes with digital download.

<iframe width="853" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/8BmzPDjPus8?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Inebrious Bastard "Escape from Misery" 7"
description:
Heavy political crust from Sydney. Total 1990s flashback to when political crust ruled over all; gutteral vocals, spoken sections, and dedication to calling out the bullshit opressors. Massive props for the song about Mr Ward, the WA Aboriginal elder who died in the back of a prison van. First pressing copies, limited to 250, hand numbered.

<iframe width="853" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/vK5sbiC3LZA?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Haymaker "Demo" LP
description: Their 2009 (I think) demo pressed to vinyl. Pretty savage hardcore, not unlike HHIG, Cursed, et al.

name: Unknown to God s/t 7"
description:
Tough, dark, and galloping hardcore in the vein of (early) The Execute (well, kinda) from these Sydney veterans. Burly as fuck and devoid of any pretension or hype.

Self released black vinyl 7", limited to 300 copies. 

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/2jWwjVpr-DM?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Rattus / Holokaust 7"
description:
MRR review, pilfered:

"Slapped in a ultra-crustified cover of skulls, bullets and band photos, this final release from the original line up of Finnish legends RATTUS commemorated their final live appearance in September at Los Angeles’s California Discord Fest, with three new songs that highlight that the band—always experimenting over the course of decades— has never really stopped evolving. Parts surface the melody riffed, guitar-driven hardcore of their classic 1980s records, but fumble a little in their complexity and a modern recording that doesn’t ever seem to pull a cohesive direction to the attack. The bass plunks, the drums hammer, and the vocals have a really uneven delivery. Add in all the different influences—from modern metal to classic ’77 style moves—and it’s just slightly off and sort of just rambles and stews. But you know what? RATTUS were fan-fucking-tastic in LA, and are still one of the world’s greatest punk bands. Ever. So I’ll keep spinning this—like any of their diehard fans—to try to glean their inspiration. Lyrics are Finnish with no translation. On the flip, Riverside, CA’s HOLOKAUST delivers three solid, meaty standard issue DISCHARGE blasts. These tracks distinguish themselves in the basic, wadded up crunch that the guitars get in their semi-lo-fi recording—a recording akin to the happy accidents of ’90s crust records, as opposed to a current intentionally lo-fi noise fest. The drums sturdily roll around this thick, dumpy chunk of simple riffs, as the vocals blast standard issue punk declarations over the din “Brainwashed into Submission!” “Waves of Fire! Mushroom cloud! Incinerated!” making for a familiarly satisfying, two fingers in the air, dose of good punk rock fun. 


<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/u5loMScDzMU?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Hatewaves "The Tombs" 5"
description:
OK, so the bloke on the cover is trying to look tough but is blighted with the kind of haircut I'd expect on a five year old boy. Don't be decieved though; this is some heavy, heavy shit, with real high tension dynamics, tough mosh parts, machine gun blast beats, and a very dark, misanthropic vibe. 

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/To1PVJIL3Ws?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Defeat 7" (black vinyl)
description:
Same as the purple vinyl but this is the regular edition. 

Members of Extortion playing in a band that isn't Extortion.

name: Nailed Down "Honour and Glory" 8" flexi
description:
Nailed Down "Honour and Glory" 8" flexi. Out of print early recordings. Deadstock copies from the band.

If this is ordered with a cassette only, both items will ship seperately.

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/RHHaXNFhi0M?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Nailed Down "Might is Right" 7"
description:
Nailed Down "Might is Right" 7". Deadstock copies from the band.

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/-08JzQsZLPQ?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Nailed Down "Resurrection" CD
description:
Deadstock copies from the band. This recording featured Rohan (Extortion, AIDS) and Dean (Rupture, Excretion, Extortion, Buronga Ridge Boys).

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/-08JzQsZLPQ?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Drapetomania tape
description:
82 + Oi! influenced Spanish language hardcore. 

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/MaeJNHitHas?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Rupture / Gorgonised Dorks 10"
description:
Limited edition of 500 on black, splattered vinyl. Seth from Anal Cunt guests on at least one Gorgonized Dorks (possibly the worst band name ever) track. The Rupture side is remastered rehearsal material from 1990. Brutal shit that you either love or hate. It's hard to be ambivalent about this.

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/wEAU4TzrmvM?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Negative Insight zine w/Disaster + Sacrilege live tape
description:
I found some copies of Negative Insight. Comes with a tape featuring live sets from Sacrilege and Disaster (yes, the band Disaster that has just been reissued on La Vida es un Mus). 

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/QkVgjKDLBLE?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Taipan 7"
description:
Self-described as "6 tracks of hateful noise from Sydney’s most notorious dickheads." 

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/31di7KKufQg?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Paintbox "Relicts" LP
description:
Collected singles from Paintbox. Think of this as Burning Spirits style hardcore plus a little extra epic psych vibes.

<iframe width="853" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/MgxQua-b1dg?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Johatsu "10 song demo" tape
description: Old fashioned 10 song cassette demo by ex-Hell No/All For One. Mid-tempo NY HC played by people that are clinging on to what they grew up on and holding onto some of what came after, all the while having a healthy disdain for what passes as Hardcore nowadays. Johatsu in Japanese means "Evaporated people" or more modernly, people who've fell off the grid, living the simple life free of the attachments society thrust upon them. We salute you. JOHATSU- "Johatsu" by Wardance Records

name: V/A "New Breed Tape Comp" 2 x LP
description:
Re-issue of this legendary NYHC compilation from 1989, originally released by Freddy Alva and Chaka from Burn. The re-mastered LP version features four exclusive bonus tracks plus the original twenty page lyric booklet.  This is the real deal last gasp of the grimey OG NY HC.

TRACK LISTING: 

1. Absolution - Never Ending Game 
2. Life's Blood - Maximum Security (live) 
3. Life's Blood - Youth Enrage (live) 
4. Life's Blood - Stick To It (live) 
5. Outburst - The Hardway 
6. Outburst - Thin Ice 
7. Outburst - Controlled (live) 
8. Our Gang - In Anger 
9. Our Gang - My Tomorrow 
10. Our Gang - Without A Home 
11. Collapse - Failure 
12. Pressure Release - Try 
13. Pressure Release - The Line 
14. Breakdown - Don't Give Up 
15. Breakdown - What It Is 
16. True Colors - No Way To Live 
17. Show Of Force - Finding It Hard 
18. Direct Approach - True Vision 
19. Direct Approach - No Respect 
20. Raw Deal - Back Track 
21. Raw Deal - Wall Of Hate 
22. Abomb-A-Nation - Disinherited 
23. Abomb-A-Nation - Something Must Be Wrong 
24. Abomb-A-Nation - Not Kosher 
25. Beyond - Seasons 
26. Beyond - Someday 
27. Direct - Reach Out 
28. Direct - One Life

37. All For One - Rise Up (LP only bonus track)

39. Life's Blood - Dennis "The Voice Of God" (live) (LP only bonus track) 
40. Life's Blood - Never Make A Change (live) (LP only bonus track) 
41. Life's Blood - It's Not In Your Heart/Resist Control (live) (LP only bonus track)

name: V/A "New Breed Tape Comp" CD
description:
This is the cd version of the double LP also in stock. I can't rep this highly enough; reissue of the seminal cassette comp demonstrating NY HC styles at the end of the 80s. Just raw, tinny, violent sounding NY HC. A true classic.

TRACK LISTING: 

1. Absolution - Never Ending Game 
2. Life's Blood - Maximum Security (live) 
3. Life's Blood - Youth Enrage (live) 
4. Life's Blood - Stick To It (live) 
5. Outburst - The Hardway 
6. Outburst - Thin Ice 
7. Outburst - Controlled (live) 
8. Our Gang - In Anger

18. Direct Approach - True Vision 
19. Direct Approach - No Respect 
20. Raw Deal - Back Track 
21. Raw Deal - Wall Of Hate 
22. Abomb-A-Nation - Disinherited 
23. Abomb-A-Nation - Something Must Be Wrong 
24. Abomb-A-Nation - Not Kosher 
25. Beyond - Seasons 
26. Beyond - Someday 
27. Direct - Reach Out 
28. Direct - One Life 
29. Uppercut - Down For The Count

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/uY6sHkuiqXg?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Rupture "49 Greatest Hates" cd
description:
As the title says, this is 49 of Rupture's classics, from the early days, right up until the end (sort of). Completely remastered and well sequenced by Sir Stumble Fuck, guaranteed to make the non-believers realise that the "new shit is as good as the old shit." This has been released by fellow Perth label R.I.P.

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/38TVB_zrAaE?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Old Skin tape
description:
Old Skin demo from Melbourne. Thrashy, lo fi hardcore. Home dubbed and spraypainted cassettes.

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/BtIgTOmtttA?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Brain Tumours 7"
description: "Six cuts of repulsive touch-n-go hardcore punk. Bright and jangled guitars onset the menacing headache while deranged vocals and roaring low-ends leave most squirming with one foot in the grave. Enough stench, hair and pus for the whole family brought to you by these four mutants. Four color screened covers."

name: Svart Framtid 7"
description:
Svart Framtid 7". Reissue of this seminal Norwegian hardcore ep from 1984.

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/YQS6_eGTDbM?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Disparo 7"
description: Disparo 7". Mid-tempo, Gilman St style hardcore from Spain. Limited pressing of 450.

name: Screaming Dead 7"
description:
Screaming Dead 7". Reissue of this early UK punk demo tape, on 7". Moody UK 82 punk/post punk vibes, with a bit of a So-Cal death rock sound. 

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/rU6whvPxt1o?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Coitus Int "Dead Excitement" 7"
description:
Coitus Int "Dead Excitement" 7". Legit reissue of this very early Dutch punk/post punk ep. Dark, moody, Gang of Four style.

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/or2yCTkyGOg?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: RF7 7"
description:
RF7 7". Bootleg of this very early, Californian punk band. 

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/f_Mrag4eUoU?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Delerium Tremens 7"
description: Delerium Tremens 7". Reissue of this very early Basque hardcore band; raw, Discharge-y, Spanish hardcore from the early 80s.

name: Lackey Die 7"
description: Lackey Die 7". Reissue of recordings from 84/85 from the first hardcore band from Charlottesville, VA.

name: Tuberculosis 7"
description:
Tuberculosis 7". Female fronted LA raw ponx, split release with Lengua Armada.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/AB3_-TnRAYQ?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Much Worse 7"
description: Much Worse "Proper Execute" 7". Pretty much sold out everywhere else. Much Worse - Mudbrain by PASS JUDGEMENT RECORDS

name: Noncens 7"
description:
Noncens 7". Reissue of killer early 1980s Swedish hardcore. Black or white vinyl.

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/8rnhYfGCAxU?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Merdoso 7"
description: Merdoso 7". Burly hardcore from SF; echo-y and dark, like 80s European hardcore punk.

name: Nemesis 7"
description: Nemesis "Duo Kokuo" 7". Vicious Japanese hardcore in the Bloodsucker tradition, with cues from mid-80s UK HC.

name: Warhead 7"
description: Warhead 7". Barabric Kyoto hardcore.

name: Amsterdamned 7"
description:
Amsterdamned 7". Urgent, female fronted Dutch punk from the early 80s. Legit reissue.

<iframe width="640" height="480" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/jpUxgjmiDto?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

name: Gawj 7"
description:
Splatter wax with obi. Japanese worshipping hardcore from New Zealand.

This is a stupid good release and it's criminal I've still got two copies for sale. If this band had been from the US and had all the connections people would shit the bed over it. But it's from New Zealand. Sound, packaging vibe; all next level. No justice.


<iframe width="420" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/MECLu0n3oHo?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
